Processes exhibiting network communicati.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 (Process Creation) and Windows Event ID 5156 (Filtering Platform Connection) on endpoints/servers. Identify processes initiating network connections. Compare against a baseline of normal process network activity. Flag processes without known network communication profiles or connections initiated without apparent user interaction. Use statistical methods (e.g., frequency analysis, time series analysis) to identify anomalous connection patterns by process name.

Modifications to host network adapter co.Action: Monitor Windows Event ID 4688 for execution of network configuration utilities (e.g., netsh.exe, PowerShell commands modifying adapters) on endpoints/servers. Look for rapid sequence of related events. Identify instances where new network interfaces (WiFi, Bluetooth) are enabled or configured. Use correlation analysis to link process execution with subsequent potential network state changes.
